title: yet another ICE with HRTB and RPIT

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
I tried this code: ```rust trait Tr { type Output; } impl Tr for () { type Output = T; } fn g() -> impl for<'a> Tr<&'a u8, Output = impl std::fmt::Debug + 'a> { } ``` [(play)](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=9eb1389a2e28dd14f2ca2e9fe2bc3051) I expected to see this happen: the code compiles. Instead, this happened: ICE. On stable this segfault because of a stackoverflow, but this was fixed by #94081. Now, on nightly (1.61.0-nightly (2022-04-03 6af09d2505f38e4f1df2) this produces internal compiler error: ```text error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/opaque_types.rs:157:17: unexpected region kind in opaque type: RePlaceholder(Placeholder { universe: U2, name: BrNamed(DefId(0:11 ~ playground[302b]::g::{opaque#0}::'a), 'a) }) ``` I've found this while working on #93582, this may be related to a similar ICE that I've found while testing it.
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/opaque_types.rs:157:17: unexpected region kind in opaque type: RePlaceholder(Placeholder { universe: U2, name: BrNamed(DefId(0:11 ~ playground[302b]::g::{opaque#0}::'a), 'a) }) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1279:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f595c65a22d -
